sk.matus.ksp.guitarist_swiss_knife

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.matus.ksp.guitarist_swiss_knife.Chord

  • public class Chord
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a representation of the musical chord.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> flagMeaning
      HashMap that assigns a meaning to each flag.
      private java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> flags
      Set containing the flags that modify the tones in the chord.
      private java.util.HashSet<Tone> progression
      This HashMap should contain the tone progression that is currently present in the chord.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Tone> scale
      A list that holds the musical scale from which the chord progression is to be derived.
      private java.lang.String stringProgression 
      private ToneUtils toneUtils
      An instance of ToneUtils class for resolving tone related queries.

        private java.util.HashSet<Tone> progression

      • stringProgression

        private java.lang.String stringProgression

      • flagMeaning

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> flagMeaning
        HashMap that assigns a meaning to each flag. The meaning is basically a complex index into complete progression of 12 semitones.

      • assignFlagMeaning

        public void assignFlagMeaning(android.content.res.Resources resources)
        The method loads flags with corresponding meaning (where meaning is the tone to alter in the chord) from .json file.
        Parameters:
        resources - The Resources class that should be used for loading the flags

      • collectTones

        private void collectTones()
        Not yet implemented version of the collectTones() method that will do the same thing, but will be working on the dependency-resolving method and a dynamic set of flags instead of hardcoded variables.

      • resolveFlag

        private Tone resolveFlag(java.lang.String flag)
        This method is supposed to resolve the flag to a Tone that the flag is supposed to add. Each flag has a meaning which is a double value. The integer part of this value represents the position at the scale, the (value - integer part) represents the semitone shift if there is any (0.5 = semitone higherSemitone, 0.0 no shift)
        Parameters:
        flag - A flag to be processed
        Returns:
        A semiTone that is resulting from the flag being set

      • getTextProgression

        public java.lang.String getTextProgression()
        Returns:
        string representation of the tone progression in a the chord

      • getSemiToneProgression

        public java.util.HashSet<Tone> getSemiToneProgression()
        Returns:
        A Set of Tone instances which represent the chord

      • constructProgression

        public void constructProgression(ToneName root)
        Iterates through the scale from which the chord is to be derived (starts at the baseName note position) and appends the tones present in the chord to the resulting string representation. This way the chord tones are printed out in the correct order and with names identical to those in the scale
        Parameters:
        root - The starting tone of the chord
